label.value: Abnormal lymph-node marginal or mantle zone morphology

value.value: Morfología anormal de la zona marginal o del manto de los ganglios linfáticos

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Abnormal lymph-node marginal or mantle zone morphology

definition.value: An abnormality of the structure of the mantle or marginal zone of a lymph node.
The normal marginal zone is the area circumferentially adjacent to the mantle zone and distal to the germinal center of a reactive (secondary) follicle.

label.value: Abnormal lymph node marginal zone morphology

value.value: Morfología anormal de la zona marginal de los ganglios linfáticos

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Abnormal lymph node marginal zone morphology

definition.value: Marginal zones are not typically present in lymph nodes, and when they are, they are difficult to distinguish from mantle zones on H&E. Marginal zones are a rim/band of lymphocytes surrounding mantle zones in secondary follicles (those containing germinal centers), and are typically only visualized in specific locations such as Peyer patches of the small bowel, or spleen, and not normally seen in lymph nodes. Expansion of marginal zones should prompt evaluation for a possible marginal zone lymphoma.

label.value: Abnormal lymph node mantle zone morphology

value.value: Morfología anormal de la zona del manto de los ganglios linfáticos

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Abnormal lymph node mantle zone morphology

value.value: Ganglio linfático con zonas de manto expandidas

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Lymph node with expanded mantle zones

label.value: Lymph node with expanded mantle zones

definition.value: Enlargement of the typical outer ring of small lymphocytes (mantle zone) surrounding a germinal center of a lymph node.

Secondary follicles (follicles with germinal centers) typically show mantle zones which are a rim or band of mostly B cells surrounding germinal centers that on H&E appears as densely packed small lymphocytes immediately surrounding germinal centers. The mantle zone is usually relatively thin (i.e. only a few rows of lymphocytes extending out from the germinal center), however may be significantly expanded, particularly in mantle cell lymphoma.

value.value: Ganglio linfático con bordes mal definidos del centro germinal

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Lymph node with poorly defined germinal center borders

label.value: Lymph node with poorly defined germinal center borders

definition.value: Reduced demarcation of the border between germinal centers and mantle zones. This border is typically seen as a crisp line on hematoxylin and eosin (H&E)-stained lymph node sections.
Although not necessarily a neoplastic feature, the border between germinal centers and mantle zones may become poorly demarcated in certain lymphomas.

value.value: Morfología anormal del centro germinal de los ganglios linfáticos
Any phenotypic abnormality of germinal centers of a lymph node.

definition.value: The germinal center is a specialized microstructure that forms in secondary lymphoid tissues, producing long-lived antibody secreting plasma cells and memory B cells, which can provide protection against reinfection.

value.value: Patrón de la zona del manto

definition.value: This refers to an architectural pattern of infiltration where atypical lymphocytes surround germinal centers, often expanding the mantle zones but without effacing architecture.
This pattern may be observed in mantle cell lymphoma.

value.value: Centros germinales con zonas marginales ausentes

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Germinal centers with absent marginal zones

label.value: Germinal centers with absent marginal zones

value.value: Folículos de ganglios linfáticos primarios mal definidos

definition.value: Lack of the typical easily recognized delineation of primary follicles within lymph nodes.

Follicles generally are relatively distinct at low magnification on H&E stained slides, however may not be obvious on the H&E stained slide, requiring immunohistochemistry to confirm the presence of follicle formation.

value.value: Transformación progresiva de los centros germinales.
This is a condition sometimes seen in a subset of germinal centers of reactive lymph nodes where germinal centers become enlarged and infiltrated by benign mantle zone cells and some T cells.

definition.value: While PTGC is a relatively common finding, there is an association with nodular lymphocyte predominant Hodgkin lymphoma, and morphologically may mimic follicular lymphoma (as well as immunohistochemically with regard to BCL2 staining if not carefully evaluated at high magnification), particularly the floral variant.

label.value: Absent germinal center tingible body macrophages

value.value: Ausencia de macrófagos del cuerpo tingible del centro germinal

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Absent germinal center tingible body macrophages

value.value: Lack of observable tingible body macrophages (TBMs) in germinal centers (GCs) of secondary lymphoid follicles. TBMs represent unique, large phagocytic cells that reside and are a subset of mononuclear phagocytes.

definition.value: Germinal centers typically contain macrophages that are engulfing cells undergoing apoptosis from the antigen selection process. The macrophages have relatively abundant cytoplasm containing apoptotic debris and are termed tingible-body macrophages (tingible is a somewhat non-specific term simply meaning capable of being stained). Tingible-body macrophages may be rare or absent in abnormal germinal centers such as in follicular lymphoma. Tingible body macrophages owe their name to their ability to actively phagocytose apoptotic lymphoid cells, and the tingible bodies (TBs) observed in their cytoplasm are apoptotic bodies.

value.value: Falta de figuras mitóticas del centro germinal

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Lack of germinal center mitotic figures

label.value: Lack of germinal center mitotic figures

definition.value: Absence of extreme paucity of mitotic figures in a lymph node germinal center.

Germinal centers typically have many cells undergoing cell division and therefore mitotic figures are frequently seen within germinal centers. If multiple germinal centers are present, it is unusual not to see at least some mitotic figures. Absent/decreased mitotic figures is an abnormal finding typically seen in low grade follicular lymphomas.

value.value: Zonas del manto no polarizadas

definition.value: Lack of the typical polarization of the outer ring of small lymphocytes (mantle zone) surrounding a germinal center of a lymph node.

Secondary follicles (follicles with germinal centers) typically show mantle zones which are a rim or band of mostly B cells surrounding germinal centers that on H&E appears as densely packed small lymphocytes immediately surrounding germinal centers. The mantle zones typically are thicker (are several rows of lymphocytes extending out from the germinal center) on one side and thinner (only one or very few rows of lymphocytes extending out from the germinal center) on the other side. This polarization is not always obvious but is often seen, and is often lost in some atypical conditions such as lymphomas involving or surrounding germinal centers.

value.value: Vasos ganglionares hialinizados

definition.value: Hyalinized means to become clear/translucent such as collagen becoming more pale staining (collagen is typically quite eosinophilic, meaning attracted to the pink/red dye eosin); however, with regard to vessels in the lymph node, hyalinization is often used to describe vessel walls that appear markedly thickened or surrounded by eosinophilic material such as collagen, not necessarily translucent appearing.

value.value: Esclerosis folicular de los ganglios linfáticos

definition.value: Collagen deposition, typically with decreased cellularity, within lymph-node follicles.

value.value: Senos ganglionares comprimidos

definition.value: Loss of the typical patency (openness) of lymph node sinuses.

Lymph node sinuses are structures that carry fluid and some cells traveling to and from the lymph node parenchyma, and often contain some histiocytes. These are normally patent but may be compressed by proliferating or infiltrating cells such as lymphoma to the point where they are no longer visible on routine H&E stained sections.

value.value: Centros de proliferación de ganglios linfáticos

definition.value: Proliferation centers are a finding specific to chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma where regions (typically relatively small, comparable to the size of a lymph node follicle) appear more pale on H&E stained sections (though they may become enlarged to merge together). These areas contain increased numbers of enlarged lymphoma cells with nucleoli (prolymphocytes and paraimmunoblasts) and show a higher proliferation rate (readily visualized with a Ki-67 immunohistochemical stain) than surrounding lymphoma cells. They can be mistaken as vague follicle formation and are therefore sometimes referred to as pseudofollicles.

value.value: Atipia citológica en células del manto.

definition.value: Lymphocytes in the mantle zones of lymph node secondary follicles show cellular atypia such as enlarged size, increased cytoplasm, atypical distribution of chromatin, or irregular nuclear contours.

This finding may raise suspicion of a neoplasm of mantle zone cells such as mantle cell lymphoma. Other lymphomas with cytologic atypia such as marginal zone lymphoma may also replace normal mantle zone cells.

value.value: Aumento de eosinófilos en los ganglios linfáticos

definition.value: Eosinophils count within a lymph node above normal limits.
Lymph nodes typically contain very few if any eosinophils but the number of eosinophils may be high in certain reactive or neoplastic states.

value.value: Aumento de células plasmáticas de los ganglios linfáticos.

definition.value: Number of plasma cells per lymph node above the upper limit of normal.
Lymph nodes typically contain some plasma cells and the number of plasma cells may be increased, sometimes forming sheets of plasma cells, in certain reactive or neoplastic conditions.

value.value: Actividad mitótica alta del centro no germinal de los ganglios linfáticos

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: High lymph node non-germinal center mitotic activity

label.value: High lymph node non-germinal center mitotic activity

definition.value: Increased numbers of mitotic figures outside of germinal centers.

Within lymph nodes, germinal centers typically show a high rate of cell division and correspondingly high number of cells undergoing mitosis. Cells outside of germinal centers typically show low levels of cell division visualized as low numbers of mitotic figures. Increased numbers of mitotic figures outside of germinal centers may be seen in certain reactive or neoplastic states.

value.value: Morfología monocitoide de los linfocitos de los ganglios linfáticos

definition.value: Lymphocytes that show morphologic features resembling monocytes, such as increased cytoplasm and slightly enlarged nuclei that are more irregular than most lymph node lymphocytes.
This finding may be seen in reactive conditions such as monocytoid B-cell hyperplasia of certain infections or in neoplastic states such as certain marginal zone lymphomas.

value.value: Reducción de la variabilidad morfológica de los linfocitos de los ganglios linfáticos.

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Reduced lymph node lymphocyte morphological variability

label.value: Reduced lymph node lymphocyte morphological variability

definition.value: Decreased morphological variability of lymph node lymphocytes as compared to the typically somewhat heterogeneous morphology of populations of benign lymph node lymphocytes.

Lymph nodes often contain primarily small lymphocytes but typically have some admixed larger lymphocytes and show a little morphological variability. Neoplastic states may show increased morphological variability or decreased morphological variability, the latter showing unusually monotonous morphology among the population of lymphocytes.

value.value: Aumento de linfocitos grandes en los ganglios linfáticos.

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Increased large lymphocytes in lymph node

label.value: Increased large lymphocytes in lymph node

definition.value: An increased number of large lymphocytes within a lymph node compared to a normal non-reactive lymph node.

Lymph nodes will often show primarily small lymphocytes with relatively few scattered large lymphocytes (often termed immunoblasts). Increased large cells may indicate a reactive condition such as mononucleosis or a neoplastic condition. It may also help differentiate two different neoplasms such as marginal zone lymphoma (which often has increased scattered large cells) and mantle cell lymphoma (which usually has decreased scattered large cells).

value.value: Células de morfología de Hodgkin.

Hodgkin cells are typically large and often show very large nucleoli and sometimes binucleation or multinucleation. Reed-Sternberg cells are a type of Hodgkin cell that is binucleated with very large nucleoli that stains slightly red on H&E stained sections (often said to mimic owl eyes). Other Hodgkin cell morphologies include cells that are dying with dark basophilic (blue) nuclei that appear somewhat smudged (mummified cells) and cells with a large space around or adjacent to the nuclei and retracted cytoplasm after tissue fixation (lacunar cells). Hodgkin cells are characteristic of Hodgkin lymphoma, however several non-Hodgkin lymphomas and noN-neoplastic conditions are known to sometimes show a few similar morphology cells.
Morfología nuclear anormal de los linfocitos de los ganglios linfáticos
Núcleos irregulares de los linfocitos de los ganglios linfáticos

definition.value: Lymph node lymphocyte nuclei that are more irregular than the typical round to slightly oval shapes of the majority of lymph node lymphocytes.
More irregularly shaped nuclei can be seen in normal germinal centers (i.e. centrocytes) and in many types of lymphomas.

value.value: Cuerpos Dutcher ganglionares

Dutcher bodies are collections of immunoglobulin protein that overlie or invaginate into the nucleus of plasma cells. These nuclear pseudoinclusions can occasionally be seen in reactive states and may be increased in specific neoplastic conditions.
Cromatina finamente dispersa de los linfocitos de los ganglios linfáticos

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Finely dispersed lymph node lymphocyte chromatin

label.value: Finely dispersed lymph node lymphocyte chromatin

definition.value: Nuclei of lymphocytes with less dense, evenly distributed chromatin than the normal densely packed, often clumped chromatin of mature lymphocytes.
This finding is seen in very immature lymphocyte precursors (i.e. lymphoblasts in lymphoblastic leukemia/lymphoma) or blastoid cells such as in blastoid mantle cell lymphoma.

value.value: Cromatina anormal de los linfocitos de los ganglios linfáticos

definition.value: Any phenotypic abnormality of the chromatin (complex of DNA and protein which comprises chromosomes) of lymphocytes that are located within a lymph node.

value.value: Agrupación de la cromatina de los linfocitos de los ganglios linfáticos

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Clumping of lymph node lymphocyte chromatin

label.value: Clumping of lymph node lymphocyte chromatin

definition.value: Nuclei of lymphocytes show multiple small densely packed areas of chromatin that appear as relatively evenly spaced clumps of basophilic (blue) staining within the nuclei on Hematoxylin and eosin (H&E) stained sections.
This is a somewhat non-specific finding but one that is often more prominent in lymphocytes of chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma.

value.value: Morfología anormal del citoplasma de los linfocitos de los ganglios linfáticos

definition.value: Any phenotypic abnormality of the cytoplasm (material located within the cell membrane but excluding the nucleus) of lymphocytes that are located within a lymph node.

value.value: Disminución del citoplasma de linfocitos de los ganglios linfáticos.

definition.value: The amount of cytoplasm in lymphocytes is even less than the relatively little cytoplasm found in the majority of lymphocytes within lymph nodes.
This finding is typically seen in centrocytes, either within normal germinal centers or neoplastic centrocytes in follicles of follicular lymphoma.

value.value: Aumento del citoplasma de linfocitos de los ganglios linfáticos.

definition.value: Increased amount of cytoplasm compared to the majority of lymphocytes in a benign lymph node.
This finding may be observed in reactive or neoplastic lymphocytes located in a lymph node.

label.value: Abnormal level of lymph-node cellular CD19 expression

value.value: Nivel anormal de expresión de CD19 celular en los ganglios linfáticos

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Abnormal level of lymph-node cellular CD19 expression

definition.value: Detection of an abnormal level of CD19 on the cell(s) of interest in a lymph node with the use of anti-CD19 antibodies conjugated to a chromogen (for immunohistochemistry) or fluorophore (for flow cytometry).
Most B-lineage lymphomas and leukemias show CD19 expression. Neoplastic plasma cells (plasma cells are derived from B cells), however, often lose CD19 expression.

label.value: Abnormal lymph-node cellular B-cell marker expression

value.value: Expresión anormal del marcador de células B de los ganglios linfáticos

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Abnormal lymph-node cellular B-cell marker expression

definition.value: Abnormal expression of an antigen (marker) that is normally expressed by B lymphocytes.
This term is intended to be applied to findings of lymph-node biopsies in diseases such as lymphoma.

label.value: Abnormal level of lymph-node cellular CD20 expression

value.value: Nivel anormal de expresión de CD20 celular en los ganglios linfáticos

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Abnormal level of lymph-node cellular CD20 expression

definition.value: Detection of abnormal levels of CD20 on the cell(s) of interest with the use of anti-CD20 antibodies conjugated to a chromogen (for immunohistochemistry) or fluorophore (for flow cytometry).
CD20 is normally expressed fairly highly on B-lineage cells, except plasma cells (down-regulate CD20 expression to the point where only a small subset of cells show expression).

value.value: Expresión de CD79a

definition.value: Detection of the presence of CD79a on the cell(s) of interest with the use of anti-CD79a antibodies conjugated to a chromogen (for immunohistochemistry) or fluorophore (for flow cytometry).
Most B-lineage lymphomas and leukemias as well as plasma cell neoplasms (plasma cells are derived from B cells) show CD79a expression.

value.value: Aumento de la expresión de CD20 celular en los ganglios linfáticos.

definition.value: Increased levels of CD20 expression compared to normal B cells.

CD20 is normally expressed fairly highly on B-lineage cells, but occasionally may show increased levels of expression relative to normal resting B cells. Increased expression is best visualized using flow cytometry when a population of normal B cells is present for comparison.

value.value: Disminución de la expresión de CD20 celular en los ganglios linfáticos.

definition.value: Decreased levels of CD20 expression compared to normal B cells.

CD20 is normally expressed fairly highly on B-lineage cells, but occasionally may show decreased levels of expression relative to normal resting B cells. Decreased expression is best visualized using flow cytometry when a population of normal B cells is present for comparison.

value.value: Disminución de la expresión de CD19 celular en los ganglios linfáticos.

definition.value: Decreased levels of CD19 expression compared to normal B cells.

CD19 is normally expressed fairly highly on B-lineage cells, but occasionally may show decreased levels of expression relative to normal resting B cells. Decreased expression is best visualized using flow cytometry when a population of normal B cells is present for comparison.

value.value: Aumento de la expresión de CD19 celular en los ganglios linfáticos.

definition.value: Increased levels of CD19 expression compared to normal B cells.

CD19 is normally expressed fairly highly on B-lineage cells, but occasionally may show increased levels of expression relative to normal resting B cells. Increased expression is best visualized using flow cytometry when a population of normal B cells is present for comparison.

value.value: Expresión de PAX5

definition.value: Detection of the presence of PAX5 on the cell(s) of interest with the use of anti-PAX5 antibodies conjugated to a chromogen (for immunohistochemistry).

PAX5 is a transcription factor that helps control B-cell lineage differentiation and is expressed in the nucleus of immature and mature B cells (including most neoplastic forms), but not in plasma cells.

value.value: Expresión de BCL2 de linfocitos B del centro germinal

definition.value: Positive staining for BCL2 apoptosis regulator protein in lymph-node germinal center B cells.

The BCL2 family of proteins regulate apoptosis, and BCL2 itself displays anti-apoptotic functions. In normal germinal centers, where antigenic selection leads to apoptosis of B cells that recognize self proteins, BCL2 is not expressed. Most low grade follicular lymphomas show aberrant expression of the anti-apoptotic protein BCL2, presumably helping to prevent the germinal center derived neoplastic B cells from undergoing apoptosis. Expression of BCL2 by germinal center B cells is abnormal and typically seen in low grade follicular lymphomas and in at least a subset of B cells in many high grade follicular lymphomas as well. Careful inspection is required when interpreting the stain, however, as normal T cells and occasionally infiltrating mantle zone B cells may also be seen in germinal centers, and these should not be interpreted as BCL2 expression in germinal center B cells.

value.value: Halluks rigidus
Hallux rigidus
Hallux rigidus

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0025004 (Hallux rigidus)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system

value.value: Hallux rigidus
Hallux rígido
拇趾强直
硬直性外反母趾
1. ayak parmağı metatarsofalangiyal eklem osteoartriti

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Osteoarthritis of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the first toe.

value.value: Osteoarthritis of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the first toe.
Osteoartritída metakarpofalangeálního kloubu palce na noze

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Osteoarthritis of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the first toe.

definition.value: Hallux rigidus is characterized by arthralgia, which is usually worsened by walking. With time the joint enlarges and the symptoms become more pronounced with pain at the dorsal bony prominence of the first metatarsophalengeal joint (MTPJ) and decreased range of motion, especially dorsiflexion. In this process the destruction of the cartilage commonly starts at the dorsal portion of the metatarsal head and the bony prominence might impinge against the proximal phalanx.. Physical examination usually shows a painful, tender and swollen first MTPJ with limited motion and pain usually when dorsiflexed. Typical radiographic findings are asymmetric joint narrowing and a flattened metatarsal head. With advancement of the disease more of the joint surface is involved and subchondral cysts, sclerosis and bony proliferation at the joint margins occur and the joint narrowing progresses [PMID:24649409].
